Class Period

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.tours.polytech.DI.RFID.objects.Period

extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a period for checking.
    Author:
    COLEAU Victor, COUCHOUD Thomas

    • Constructor Detail

      • Period

        public Period(java.lang.String period)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        period - A string representing the period. This should be formatted as xxhxx-yyhyy where xx and yy are the time to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the period isn't formatted as it should be.

    • Method Detail

      • loadPeriods

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Period> loadPeriods()
        Used to get all the periods from the config file.
        Returns:
        An array list of the periods.

      • getTimeInterval

        public java.lang.String getTimeInterval()
        Used to get a String representing this interval.
        Returns:
        A string formatted as xxHxx - yyHyy

      • isInPeriod

        public boolean isInPeriod(java.util.Date date)
        Used to know if the date is in this period.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to verify.
        Returns:
        true if the date is in the period, false if not.

      • isOverlapped

        public boolean isOverlapped(Period period)
        Used to know if two Period objects are overlapping.
        Parameters:
        period - The other Period to check with.
        Returns:
        true if overlapping, false if not.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Used to get a String representing this interval. This is mostly used when saving the object to the config, should use getTimeInterval instead.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string formatted as xxHxx-yyHyy
